Package chase.minecraft.architectury.warpmod.utils

Class WorldUtils

java.lang.Object
chase.minecraft.architectury.warpmod.utils.WorldUtils
public class WorldUtils extends Object
The WorldUtils class contains various static methods for calculating Minecraft's World information.

  • Method Details

    • calculateRandom

      public static org.joml.Vector4f calculateRandom(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerLevel level, net.minecraft.world.phys.Vec3 center, int min, int max)
      This function calculates a random location within a certain range around a given center point in a Minecraft server level, ensuring that the location is safe to spawn in.
      Parameters:
      level - A ServerLevel object representing the game world in which the random position will be calculated.
      center - A Vec3 representing the center point around which the random position will be generated.
      min - The minimum distance from the center point that the random position can be generated at.
      max - The maximum distance from the center point that the random position can be generated at.
      Returns:
      A Vector4f object is being returned, which contains the randomly generated location (as a Vector3f) and the distance from the center point.

    • isSafe

      public static SaftyCheckResponse isSafe(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerLevel level, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos blockPos)
      The function checks if a block position is safe to stand on in a Minecraft server level.
      Parameters:
      level - The Minecraft server level in which the block is located.
      blockPos - The position of the block being checked for safety.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a SaftyCheckResponse, which is an enum that can have one of three values: SAFE, UNSAFE, or AIR.

    • getLevelFromID

      @Nullable public static @Nullable net.minecraft.server.level.ServerLevel getLevelFromID(@Nullable @Nullable net.minecraft.server.MinecraftServer server, net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation id)
      Gets the level from the resource location
      Parameters:
      server - - the minecraft server
      id - - the resource location of the dimension
      Returns:
      the dimension

    • teleportRandom

      public static boolean teleportRandom(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, int min, int max)
      This Java function teleports a server player to a random location within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      player - The player that will be teleported randomly within a certain range of coordinates.
      min - The minimum distance (in blocks) that the player can be teleported away from their current location.
      max - The maximum distance (in blocks) that the player can be teleported randomly from their current location.
      Returns:
      The method `teleportRandom` is returning a boolean value. The value being returned is the result of calling the method `teleportRandom` with the parameters `player`, `min`, `max`, and `true`.

    • teleportRandom

      public static boolean teleportRandom(net.minecraft.server.level.ServerPlayer player, int min, int max, boolean sendMessage)
      The function teleports a player to a random location within a specified range and returns true if successful.
      Parameters:
      player - The player that is being teleported.
      min - The minimum distance (in blocks) that the player can be teleported away from their current position.
      max - The maximum distance (in blocks) that the player can be teleported away from their current position.
      sendMessage - A boolean value that determines whether or not to send a message to the player about the teleportation. If set to true, a message will be sent. If set to false, no message will be sent.
      Returns:
      The method returns a boolean value, either true or false.

    • calculateTravel

      public static net.minecraft.network.chat.Component calculateTravel(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player fromPlayer, net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player toPlayer)
      The function calculates the travel distance between two players in a game.
      Parameters:
      fromPlayer - The player who is starting the travel.
      toPlayer - The "toPlayer" parameter is an instance of the Player class, which represents a player in the game. It contains information about the player's position, such as their X, Y, and Z coordinates. The method "calculateTravel" takes this parameter as input and uses the player's position to
      Returns:
      The method `calculateTravel` is returning a `Component` object.

    • calculateTravel

      public static net.minecraft.network.chat.Component calculateTravel(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player, double x, double y, double z)
      The function calculates the relative rotation angle between a player and a target location and creates a progress bar using Minecraft's chat component system based on the percentage of how much an object is offscreen to the left or right.
      Parameters:
      player - A Player object representing the player for whom the progress bar is being calculated.
      x - The x-coordinate of the target location that the player is traveling towards.
      y - The parameter "y" is not used in the given code and therefore has no significance in this context.
      z - The z-coordinate of the target location that the player is traveling towards.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a progress bar as a Minecraft chat component.

    • removeTravelBar

      public static void removeTravelBar(net.minecraft.world.entity.player.Player player)
      This function removes a custom boss event and cancels a repeating server task for a specific player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom the travel bar needs to be removed.
